summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report documenting an interview with inmate Steven Lopez at the Manhattan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 20, 2019. Lopez, who worked as a garbage collector and orderly, was questioned about a tip alleging a cover-up involving the shredding of sensitive documents related to inmate Jeffrey Epstein. Lopez denied any knowledge or involvement.

persons.name: Steven Lopez
persons.context: Interviewed by FBI and OIG agents regarding a tip about potential shredding of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein. He worked collecting garbage at the MCC.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the subject of the tip alleging a cover-up involving shredded documents at the MCC.

connections.description: Lopez was interviewed as a potential witness regarding activities (document shredding) allegedly connected to Epstein's case at the MCC.

events.title: FBI/OIG Interview of Steven Lopez
events.description: FBI and Office of Inspector General agents interviewed inmate Steven Lopez at the Manhattan Correctional Center regarding a tip about potential shredding of sensitive documents related to Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: A tip was received alleging a cover-up involving the shredding of sensitive documents related to Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC.
Inmate Steven Lopez, who collected garbage at the MCC, was interviewed and denied any knowledge of document shredding or the alleged cover-up.
Lopez stated he observed 'a little more shredded trash than usual, maybe 2 days more,' but had no specific information linking it to Epstein.
The interview was conducted as part of investigation 90A-NY-3151227.
